nodes.name: Webhook - Analyze Profile
nodes.notes:
üîó WEBHOOK ENDPOINT

This webhook receives POST requests with LinkedIn profile URLs to analyze.

Expected payload:
{
  "url": "linkedin.com/in/username"
}

Setup:
1. Save this workflow first
2. Copy the webhook URL from the node details
3. Use this URL in your frontend application

actorId.cachedResultName: Linkedin Profile Details Scraper + EMAIL (No Cookies Required)

nodes.name: Apify - LinkedIn Scraper
nodes.notes:
üï∑Ô∏è LINKEDIN PROFILE SCRAPER

Uses Apify's LinkedIn Profile Scraper to extract profile data.

Setup Required:
1. Create Apify account at https://apify.com
2. Get API key from Apify console
3. Add Apify credential in n8n
4. This actor ID (VhxlqQXRwhW8H5hNV) is for 'Linkedin Profile Details Scraper + EMAIL (No Cookies Required)'

Settings:
- Timeout: 60 seconds
- Wait for finish: Yes
- Memory: Default

The scraper extracts:
- Basic info (name, headline, location)
- Work experience with dates
- Education history
- Skills and endorsements
- About section
- Contact information

nodes.name: Get Scraper Results
nodes.notes:
üìä RETRIEVE SCRAPED DATA

Gets the scraped LinkedIn profile data from Apify's dataset.

This node:
- Fetches results from the scraper run
- Always outputs data (even if empty)
- Passes structured profile data to next nodes

Data structure includes:
- basic_info: name, headline, location, about
- experience: work history with dates
- education: degrees and institutions
- skills: extracted skills and endorsements

conditions.rightValue: No profile found or wrong input

nodes.name: Check Profile Found
nodes.notes:
üîç PROFILE VALIDATION

Checks if LinkedIn profile was successfully scraped.

Flow:
- TRUE: Profile found ‚Üí Continue to scoring
- FALSE: Profile not found ‚Üí Return error response

This prevents processing empty or failed scrapes.

nodes.name: Preliminary Scoring
nodes.notes:
üéØ PRELIMINARY SCORING ENGINE

Performs initial rule-based analysis of LinkedIn profile data.

SCORING SYSTEM (100 points total):

üìä EXPERIENCE (40 points max):
- 11+ years: 40 points
- 6-10 years: 30 points
- 3-5 years: 20 points
- 1-2 years: 10 points
- 0 years: 0 points

üéì EDUCATION (30 points max):
- PhD/Doctorate: 30 points
- Master's/MBA: 25 points
- Bachelor's: 15 points
- High School: 5 points

üè≠ INDUSTRY (30 points max):
- Technology: 30 points
- Finance: 25 points
- Healthcare: 20 points
- Other: 10 points

üîß FEATURES:
- Extracts experience years from date ranges
- Classifies education level from degree names
- Identifies industry from job titles and descriptions
- Extracts skills from profile text and hashtags
- Creates AI prompt for enhanced analysis
- FIXED: Enhanced position extraction with company context

This data is then sent to AI for enhancement and refinement.

nodes.name: Google Gemini AI
nodes.notes:
ü§ñ GOOGLE GEMINI AI MODEL

Provides the AI language model for enhanced analysis.

Setup Required:
1. Get Google AI Studio API key from https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey
2. Add Google Gemini credential in n8n
3. Enter your API key

Model Settings:
- Model: gemini-2.5-flash (fast and cost-effective)
- Temperature: 0.1 (focused, deterministic responses)

This model is connected to the LLM Chain node for processing.

nodes.name: AI Analysis Chain
nodes.notes:
üîó AI ANALYSIS CHAIN

Processes the LLM prompt through Google Gemini for enhanced analysis.

This node:
- Takes the structured prompt from Preliminary Scoring
- Sends it to Google Gemini AI
- Returns enhanced analysis for education, industry, and skills
- Provides confidence levels and reasoning

AI Enhancement:
- Better education level detection
- More accurate industry classification
- Improved skills extraction
- Confidence scoring
- Reasoning explanations

The AI analysis is then combined with rule-based scoring in the next node.

nodes.name: Enhanced Scoring
nodes.notes:
üöÄ ENHANCED SCORING ENGINE

Combines rule-based scoring with AI analysis for superior accuracy.

AI ENHANCEMENTS:

üéì Education Analysis:
- AI better detects degree levels from descriptions
- Handles international degrees and certifications
- Provides confidence levels and reasoning

üè≠ Industry Classification:
- AI understands context and nuanced job descriptions
- Better classification of mixed-industry roles
- Handles emerging industries and job titles

üîß Skills Enhancement:
- AI extracts skills from natural language descriptions
- Identifies implied skills from job responsibilities
- Combines with rule-based keyword extraction

üìä ROBUST PROCESSING:
- Graceful fallback to rule-based analysis if AI fails
- Validation of AI responses
- Confidence scoring for each enhancement
- Transparency in AI vs rule-based decisions

RESULT:
- More accurate scoring
- Better profile understanding
- Detailed reasoning for decisions
- Confidence levels for each metric

This enhanced data is then stored in databases and returned to the user.

nodes.name: Success Response
nodes.notes:
‚úÖ SUCCESS RESPONSE

Returns the complete analysis results to the web interface.

Response includes:
- All profile information
- Scoring breakdown
- AI analysis results
- Confidence levels
- Reasoning explanations
- Processing metadata

This is the final output sent back to your frontend application.

nodes.name: Error Response
nodes.notes:
‚ùå ERROR RESPONSE

Returns structured error response when profile cannot be found.

Common causes:
- Invalid LinkedIn URL
- Private profile
- Profile doesn't exist
- LinkedIn blocking/rate limiting
- Network issues

Error format:
{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "PROFILE_NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "Description of the issue",
    "details": "Additional context"
  }
}

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO profiles (
    id,
    linkedin_url,
    full_name,
    current_position,
    current_company,
    location,
    total_experience_years,
    education_level,
    industry,
    skills,
    experience_score,
    education_score,
    industry_score,
    total_score,
    qualification_level,
    processing_status,
    created_at,
    updated_at
) VALUES (
    gen_random_uuid(),
    '{{ $json.linkedin_url }}',
    '{{ $json.full_name.replace(/'/g, "''") }}',
    '{{ $json.current_position.replace(/'/g, "''") }}',
    '{{ $json.current_company.replace(/'/g, "''") }}',
    '{{ $json.location.replace(/'/g, "''") }}',
    {{ $json.total_experience_years }},
    '{{ $json.education_level }}',
    '{{ $json.industry }}',
    '{{ JSON.stringify($json.skills) }}'::jsonb,
    {{ $json.experience_score }},
    {{ $json.education_score }},
    {{ $json.industry_score }},
    {{ $json.total_score }},
    '{{ $json.qualification_level }}',
    'completed',
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
)
ON CONFLICT (linkedin_url)
DO UPDATE SET
    full_name = EXCLUDED.full_name,
    current_position = EXCLUDED.current_position,
    current_company = EXCLUDED.current_company,
    location = EXCLUDED.location,
    total_experience_years = EXCLUDED.total_experience_years,
    education_level = EXCLUDED.education_level,
    industry = EXCLUDED.industry,
    skills = EXCLUDED.skills,
    experience_score = EXCLUDED.experience_score,
    education_score = EXCLUDED.education_score,
    industry_score = EXCLUDED.industry_score,
    total_score = EXCLUDED.total_score,
    qualification_level = EXCLUDED.qualification_level,
    processing_status = 'completed',
    updated_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP;

nodes.name: PostgreSQL Storage
nodes.notes:
üóÑÔ∏è POSTGRESQL STORAGE

Stores profile analysis results in PostgreSQL database.

Setup Required:
1. Install PostgreSQL
2. Create database named 'linkedin_profiles'
3. Create credentials in n8n with connection details
4. Run the SQL schema from the repository

Database Schema:
- profiles table with all scoring fields
- JSONB skills storage for flexible querying
- UPSERT logic (INSERT or UPDATE if exists)
- Timestamps for created/updated tracking

SQL Features:
- Conflict resolution by linkedin_url
- Automatic UUID generation
- Proper escaping for SQL injection protection
- JSONB for skills array storage

This enables:
- Analytics and reporting
- Historical tracking
- Bulk operations
- Performance monitoring

nodes.name: Create Notion Page
nodes.notes:
üìù NOTION DATABASE INTEGRATION

Creates a new page in Notion database with profile analysis.

Setup Required:
1. Create Notion integration at https://www.notion.so/my-integrations
2. Create database with all the required properties
3. Share database with your integration
4. Add Notion credential in n8n
5. Replace YOUR_NOTION_DATABASE_ID with actual database ID

Database Properties Required:
- Full Name (Title)
- LinkedIn URL (URL)
- Current Position (Rich Text)
- Current Company (Rich Text)
- Location (Rich Text)
- Experience Years (Number)
- Education Level (Select: high_school, bachelor, master, phd)
- Industry (Select: technology, finance, healthcare, other)
- Skills (Multi-select)
- Summary (Rich Text)
- Experience Score (Number)
- Education Score (Number)
- Industry Score (Number)
- Total Score (Number)
- Qualification Level (Select: unqualified, poor, average, good, excellent)
- Processed At (Date)
- LLM Education Reasoning (Rich Text)
- LLM Industry Reasoning (Rich Text)
- LLM Skills Reasoning (Rich Text)
- LLM Education Confidence (Select: high, medium, low, unknown)
- LLM Industry Confidence (Select: high, medium, low, unknown)
- LLM Skills Confidence (Select: high, medium, low, unknown)
- LLM Analysis Status (Select: success, fallback)

This creates a collaborative workspace for team review and analysis.

nodes.name: Check Existing Notion Page
nodes.notes:
üîç CHECK EXISTING NOTION PAGE

Checks if a profile already exists in Notion database.

This node:
- Searches for existing page by LinkedIn URL
- Returns page ID if found
- Returns empty if not found
- Always outputs data for next node decision

Use Case:
- Prevents duplicate pages
- Enables update vs create logic
- Maintains data integrity

Next Node Decision:
- If page exists ‚Üí Update existing page
- If page doesn't exist ‚Üí Create new page

nodes.name: Page Exists?
nodes.notes:
üîÑ NOTION PAGE EXISTS CHECK

Decides whether to update existing page or create new one.

Logic:
- TRUE: Page exists ‚Üí Update existing page
- FALSE: Page doesn't exist ‚Üí Create new page

This ensures:
- No duplicate pages
- Updated information for existing profiles
- Clean database structure

nodes.name: Update Notion Page
nodes.notes:
üìù UPDATE EXISTING NOTION PAGE

Updates existing Notion page with latest analysis results.

This node:
- Updates key fields that might change
- Preserves existing data
- Updates timestamp
- Maintains page history

Updated Fields:
- Full Name (in case of name changes)
- Current Position (job changes)
- Total Score (scoring improvements)
- Qualification Level (level changes)
- Processed At (analysis timestamp)

Benefit:
- Maintains single source of truth
- Tracks changes over time
- Keeps team collaboration context
- Avoids duplicate pages
